## Type of Change
<!-- Mark the relevant option with an [x] -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Security fix
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Refactoring

## Checklist
<!-- Mark items with [x] when completed -->

### Code Quality
- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes

### Security & Compliance
- [ ] I have reviewed the security scan results (CodeQL, Semgrep, Trivy)
- [ ] No high or critical vulnerabilities are introduced
- [ ] Security scan issues have been reviewed and addressed or documented
- [ ] Secrets and sensitive data are not committed
- [ ] Dependencies are scanned for known vulnerabilities
- [ ] SBOM diff has been reviewed (for releases)

### Governance
- [ ] This PR has the `human-approved` label (required before merge)
- [ ] An independent reviewer has approved this PR (not the author)
- [ ] CODEOWNERS have been notified for critical path changes
- [ ] Breaking changes are documented in CHANGELOG.md
- [ ] Commit messages follow Conventional Commits format

### Risk Assessment
- [ ] Low risk: Minor changes, well-tested
- [ ] Medium risk: Moderate changes, some testing gaps
- [ ] High risk: Significant changes, requires careful review
- [ ] Security risk accepted: `security-risk-accepted` label applied (if applicable)
